(44) 618.4:th November, 1944.WAR 2AI INE \PREPARATION OF PARLIAMENTARY REGISTER.Memorandum by the Lord Privy Seal.THE Home Secretary has now conceded a plan for a Register frozen on the31st January, 1945, and in operation on the 15th May. Further that Register isto be brought up to date as of the 30th June for operation on the 15th October.This disposes of the need for the long delay of seven and a half weeks betweenthe issue of the writ and the date of the election contemplated ujider the acts of 1943 and 1944.It also disposes of any possible controversy over the question of a continuingRegister.In accepting this new situation I strongly urge the War Cabinet to fix onthe 1st January and the 1st July, 1945, as the dates for freezing the lists, thusgiving us an operative Parliamentary Register on the 15th March and the15th September.There can be no difficulty in printing the lists in newspaper offices engaged on the production of morning newspapers, and whose plant is therefore available through the day.B.Copy No.Gwydyr House, Whitehall, S. W. 1,4cth November, 1944.[28530]
